author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...KIKO FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAII TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... ...LIFE-THREATENING RIP CURRENTS AND HIGH SURF POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF HAWAIIAN ISLANDS...
summary: ...KIKO FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAII TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... ...LIFE-THREATENING RIP CURRENTS AND HIGH SURF POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... As of 5:00 AM HST Tue Sep 09 the center of Kiko was located near 22.4, -153.4 with movement WNW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...KIKO FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAII TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... ...LIFE-THREATENING RIP CURRENTS AND HIGH SURF POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... As of 5:00 AM HST Tue Sep 09 the center of Kiko was located near 22.4, -153.4 with movement WNW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Kiko (CP4/EP112025)
